inn1.comm: starts full outside off, some swing, and the umpire decides it's too wide
gets away a drive as he comes into the front foot, not perfectly timed as he bisects cover and mid-off
on a length, straight, tucked into midwicket
that's a wild drive from Roy and the ball skims past the inside edge of the bat...was full and wide, just a hit of swing. No holding back
drags the length back, outside off, defended into the covers
full outside off, left alone
comes down the pitch outside off, it's back of a length, takes the pad to the off side
starts with a very full ball outside off, a chance for Vince to bring out the cover drive which he doesn't miss out on...races through the covers
pulls the length back a touch, quite wide, Vince pondered having a dart but left it alone
that's sweetly timed as he comes forward and drives towards mid-off who fumbles but they can't steal the single
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
opens the face as he comes forward, placed of wide backward point
length ball at off stump, defended firmly into midwicket
gets across the stumps and flicks this from outside off through midwicket
length on off stump, doesn't get up much as Roy defends
what a piece of timing that is, he stands tall and punches this delightfully off the back foot between cover and mid-off. That's such a classy stroke
fuller, on off stump, Roy is across his crease and works to midwicket
now he's down the pitch and then picks this up from around off stump and flicks it nonchalantly off midwicket...just short of a full house
back of a length, dabbed to backward point
this flies off a leading edge as Roy aims to work a full ball to the leg side...almost a return catch, and not far from reaching mid-off.
flash and a miss outside off as he chases some width...huge roar from the crowd
goes for the lofted drive and just manages to chip it over mid-off, didn't get his timing on this occasion, bat twisted a little in his hand
a back-foot square drive this time which whistles to point
played forward outside off with hard hands, a thick outside edge runs to third man
length ball at off stump, defended to cover
round the wicket, nicely loop, full on the stumps and driven to cover
angled in at leg stump from wide on the crease, pushed into midwicket
full and straight, defend...yelps from Mushfiqur behind the stumps
played into the off side
gets a better stride in this time and drives down to long-off
brings out the reverse sweep, full and straight, connects cleanly and it races through short third man
throws his hands through some width and gets a thick top edge down to third man
he's striking his drives nicely today, but this one finds cover
almost takes out Vince at the non-striker's end with a bludgeoned on-drive, Vince has to take evasive action then mid-on does very well to dive and cut-off the boundary
that's trademark Vince, a flowing cover drive, but he picks out cover
not quite so wide this time, Vince presses forward and drives towards mid-off...it might have been a tightish single but it's not fielded cleanly
back of a length and beats the top edge with a touch of extra bounce, Roy as trying to play this square on the off side
uses his feet then flicks this in the air over midwicket and wide of mid-on
some excellent cricket on show here, a lovely stroke by Vince as he moves to the leg side to open the off then drives inside-out over extra cover...long-off makes good crowd and an super save
pushed into the off side
now it's Roy lofting inside-out over cover, stops his shot it's more placement than power, plugs a little on the outfield towards deep cover
straighter delivery, bunted down to long-off
sweeps a straight delivery strongly to deep square
length outside off, driven to mid-off

picks out mid-on! First one for Bangladesh. Vince was aiming to go straight down the ground, ball was a touch too short for the shot, comes high off the bat, which twisted in his hands, and loops comfortably to mid-on. Adjustment of length pays dividends for Shafiul
the batsmen crossed so it's Roy on strike, he defends a length ball to midwicket
short of a length outside off, a crunching back-foot drive but he's starting to find the fielders a bit more now...picks out short cover
gets this one through the off side with the help of backward point who dives over the ball, a strong square drive off the front foot. Just a little too much width
straightens his line onto off stump, punched sweetly back down the pitch but the bowler flings himself across
over the wicket, touch short outside off, doesn't bounce much at all, played into the off side
goes for the cut, a quicker ball skids on outside off, he gets beaten over the top edge
comes forward and works this from outside off to midwicket
he's off the mark, flicks down to long-on...that will help him settle
wide outside off, Roy fetches it with a sweep and finds square leg inside the circle
driven off the back foot down to long-off
back of a length outside off, defended on the walk to cover
driven back to the bowler...just looks as though Roy is getting a little twitchy
lovely bit of a touch play from Roy, it's a straight ball which he waits for them opens the face at the last moment to guide it wide of the keeper and fine of third man

flogs a length ball towards mid-off, who pulls off a direct hit...they will go upstairs but think Roy has made his ground. No great excitement in the field. Well, he placed, rather than ran his bat in, but he's safe enough
a length ball angled across outside off, sliced to backward point
goes after width outside off, cuts towards point who can't stop it cleanly
driven out to deep cover
pushed to mid-off, kept a bit low on him
that's dismissive from Roy, goes down his back keen then slog-sweeps this over deep midwicket
flatter, quicker, pushed to the on side
now he slices away a wider delivery outside off through backward point
round the wicket, full and straight, defended back towards the bowler
outside off, holding the ball back slightly, driven to cover

big wicket! Roy was keen to press on. Came down the pitch, was looking to clear the straight boundary, just sliced across the ball slightly and it didn't have the legs to clear long-off. Timely blow for Shakib
full outside off, flicked to midwicket
drives, slides off a thick outside edge through short third man
comes forward and drives to mid-off
round the wicket to the right hander, tucked off the pads into midwicket
tries to work a full ball into the leg side and gets a leading edge to the off side

direct hit! Bairstow looks to be struggling! Pushed towards mid-off and set off straight away. Bairstow is quick, but it always looked a tight run and he's well short here. Excellent piece of fielding from Sabbir
nudged off the pads to midwicket
full, pushed back to the bowler
throws his hands through a drive which finds deep cover
round the wicket, dragged down a touch short, Duckett rocks back and pulls wide of mid-on but it doesn't quite have the legs for a boundary...but good work in the deep
driven to short cover off the back foot
touch shorter outside off, cracked from the back foot to deep cover
full and straight, nudged to the covers
a flat-batted drive into the covers, the Shakib parries it behind him to allow a single
fiddled off a thick inside edge to the leg side
goes back in his crease to quite a full ball and plays to midwicket
forward this time and drives to cover
shorter ball on the pads, Stokes can't flick it away...bobbles down by his feet
tight on off stump, carefully defended
takes a thick inside edge into his pad as he plays forward
gets forward and flicks a full delivery from around off stump down to long on...tight over
round the wicket, whipped off the back foot to midwicket
flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
releases some of the presser with a lofted drive over mid-off, flicking through the shot with strong wrists which allows him to clear the fielder
cracked off the back foot to mid-off
uses his feet then works along the ground to deep midwicket

has Stokes dragged his back foot? Appeal for the stumping. Goes upstairs. The ball slid past the outside edge, a swift bit of work from Mustfiqur. Nah, he's fine. The foot remains firmly grounded behind the line
onto the front foot and pushed firmly to cover
fractionally back of a length and wafted out to point
solidly into line to push hard to cover once more
that's the one from Duckett. A fraction straighter, and swung lustily over midwicket for a couple of bounces. Didn't over-hit the ball but nailed it all the same
reverse sweep, plays it well - a full rotation of his stance to slap the ball through point
cramped for room by one that turns into the legs. Worked to midwicket
just enough bottom edge on another lusty sweep
back and across and defended
down the track, a couple of strides, to defend
easing back into the crease to work into the leg side
another well-nailed sweep - this deliveries are coming thick and fast. Not much time to think, but he's picking his shots well
down the track with intent, and a loose-shouldered launch over long-off! Well batted, first hands, strong wrists. He is looking the part in a tough baptism
a fraction too short, and Stokes' eyes lit up at that one! Leans back, gets right under the ball and muscles it high into the midwicket stands!
solidly onto the front foot
not quite there for the drive, but inside-edged down to long-on
squared up on the back foot by a fuller length. Blocked
worked off the hip, but Mushfiqur dashes round to gather
onto the front foot, and pushed to cover.
defended into the leg side
worked off the pads to short midwicket
a fraction too short and flat-batted out to the midwicket sweeper
on the pads, worked square once again
worked into the gap for the single
an ambitious reverse sweep, strikes the pad to huge acclaim from the fielders, but they opt not to review. That straightened appreciably, but maybe pitched outside leg
onto the front foot and pushed to cover
down on the sweep again, cannons into his visor, but no alarm
worked to mid-on
down the track with intent, but this is padded away in the end
hanging back in the crease this time and settling for the single into the covers
shuffling to leg to make room, but tightening up on off stump in the final analysis
spanked over midwicket and straight out of the meat! Down on one knee, and drilled high and handsome. Power
forward and pushed to the off side
round the wicket, and that's a very delicate sweep, getting outside off to deflect very fine past the keeper
onto the front foot, and pushed down to mid-on to bring up the fifty stand. From 55 balls, which is fine given the slightly precarious position from which they started
clipped to the leg side
down the track to work the angles to long-on. Another single
round the wicket, good bounce from a tight line and defended
too short this time, and Stokes has been excellent whenever the length has strayed. Hoisted through midwicket once more
forward and pushed to the off side
reverse-swept, and that's tremendous power and placement. Beefed through backward point (as was) for yet another four. He's picking them off ...
better delivery, much fuller, and threatening to straighten from a middle-and-leg line
defended from the crease
forward and blocked to the off side
tossed up, round the wicket and pitching outside off. Duckett reaches for the drive but can't quite nail it
nurdled to midwicket
hoisted high out towards midwicket, there are two men on the rope ... but neither can get close! Stokes didn't quite nail that, but it plopped happily onto the turf behind the rope
flicked to leg
down the track, worked to the leg side, but backward square is on hand to tidy up
banged in on a leg-stump line, whittled to midwicket
outside off, a loose-limbed swish but the ball is through to the keeper. The step-up in pace might take a ball or two to get used to, after such a diet of spin
back and across and blocked into the leg side
banged in short, and that was spring-loaded as it fizzes through to the keeper! Duckett was pulling but the ball was a foot too high
outside off, dabbed down to third man with a roll of the wrists
that's a poor delivery, outside leg and staying that way. Flicked off the hip and England's position improves by four more
round the wicket, looping back into the left-hander who drills wristily into the covers
back of a length and flopped out to cover with lots of bottom hand
back and across to defend, and the sound of a Mexican Wave fills Mirpur
tries to work to leg but can't time it
reverse sweep, he has played that very well all day, and it's an apt way to bring up a very important half-century. A mature performance
full length, pokey defence into the off side
back of a length, defended into the leg side
beaten outside off, good carry through to the keeper
good delivery, this one nibbles from leg to off and takes a bit of a leading edge out to cover
tremendous batting, the Jos-Buttler-esque inside-out scoop over the keeper's head. Using the back-of-a-length line to hoist it for one bounce
much fuller length, Duckett drives but without timing back to the bowler
slower ball, a roll of the wrists, and through to the keeper. Excellent bowling
that's a murderous thump! Stokes marches down the track and batters the spinner high over long-on and into the sightscreen
working off the straight and narrow, out to point
back of a length, as someone on the microphone exclaims "weeeee!" as if heading down the helter-skelter
cut out to point, off the toe but well enough placed
advancing down the pitch, worked to leg
reverse-swept yet again, such a productive stroke today. The field can't keep up with the angles that Duckett is finding, as this one bounds through the gap at backward point
back of a length, zippy delivery, and pulled urgently to backward square
cracked out to the covers and a well-timed single. Mid-off swoops but they are safely home

that's a peach! Beautiful line and length, and this one nips back off the seam and bounces as well, which is just as well for Stokes as that would have sent middle stump cartwheeling if it had stayed low
that's a fine riposte! Battered hard back at the bowler, who choose discretion over valour as he turns turtle!
blocked on the front foot to the leg side
flicked off the pads down to fine leg. Another single to the cause
back of a length, clipped straight to midwicket
outside off, a flowing stroke off the back foot, but cover intercepts
on the back foot, and clipped to the leg side
outside off, and nurdled down to  third man
outside off, just a fraction too short, and wafted out to the point sweeper
on the pads, clipped to the leg side. That's a tidy return to the fray
wide down the leg side
outside off, jabbed to backward point

spanked hard to mid-on where Mahmudullah drops it! That was sizzling, and he had to make ground, but how costly will that be? In fact, he so nearly managed to balance that chance on his chest as he rolled backwards
outside off, takes the edge down to third man
crunched into the off side
pounded out to deep midwicket, slightly back of a length but well timed on the pull
slower ball, grips in the pitch and deflected down to third man. A tidy over, but could have been a breakthrough one
on the pads, angling across the left-hander and worked to midwicket
slapped out to deep cover, it's the slower one, but Stokes got right underneath that one and skewed it high and ugly, but it is dropped! That's a poor effort
tapped to the off side to keep the strike rotating
outside off and defended
full and floaty, and clipped to short midwicket
worked off the hip
short and leg-sided, hoicked behind square
fuller length, clipped to the leg side
on the hip again, a tight and restrictive leg-stump line to the left-handers
short and swung away hard to deep midwicket where Kayes tumbles well to cut off the four
outside off, and defended to point
outside off, and guided past the diving backward point
defended to the gully off the back foot
fantastic batting from Stokes, reversed his hands and pings a backward pull through backward point. Standing tall in his crease and just trusting his eye and timing
advancing down the pitch, pushed back to the bowler
on the pads, tickled to square leg to keep the singles coming
worked to leg and that is Duckett's fifty on debut! From 63 balls, and with immense resolve and talent. What can he do now with a bit more licence to have a dart?
on the pads, worked to leg
gives himself room to the leg side and crunches this through the covers, so much more in the stroke
this shot is quite so pleasing on the eye, he's down the pitch again and aiming over the leg side then gets an inside edge past leg stump
whipped to deep midwicket
sweeps this strongly well in front of square, picking the gaps smartly in the outfield...been a very impressive hand on debut
comes down the pitch and taps to long-on
goes back in the crease outside leg and bunts down the ground
round the wicket, on the stumps, defended to the bowler
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot down the ground...Stokes taking in some deep breaths, hot work out there
lovely piece of bowling, deceives Duckett with a slower ball which grips and jags away from around leg stump to beat the edge and travel over the stumps
lands into space! Fortune for Duckett this time. Gets too far underneath as shovel-pull, takes the top edge, but splits the gap between three fielders running towards deep square
opens the face, drives to cover
full at off stump, a leading edge shoots back along the ground towards Mashrafe who bends his bionic knees to get down to it. Good over.
brings out the reverse sweep again, he loves that shot, connects superbly and sends it over backward point...toying with the field
opens his stances and drives down the ground
moves well outside leg and drives a full delivery off the stumps past the bowler
dropped, that's a sharp chance put down at backward square leg as Duckett sweeps very hard from outside leg stump. Probably the hardest of the three, but another life.
driven to cover
a full toss and he can't find a gap in the off side
that's brilliant from Stokes, Mashrafe round the wicket and he just deposits him over short third man with another reverse swat. Outstanding strokeplay
full at off stump, pinged back at the bowler along the ground
back of a length, opens the face a touch and punches (maybe that word shouldn't be used for Stokes) to deep cover
over the wicket, full outside off, flat-batted to cover
cut away from off stump, picks out point this time...can he hold his nerve with these dot balls?
beaten by a slower ball, back of a length, he goes for a tired-looking pull and is through his shot early
full at off stump, solid defence on the front foot
goes deep in the crease and swings a shorter delivery to long
now he sweeps the seamer, picks out short fine leg
uses his feet, outside leg stump, drags a full ball to long-on
flay and a miss as the ball is slanted across outside off
and he's gone now! Goes too far across the crease and tries to sweep, misses a low full toss which takes the bottom of the leg stump
round the wicket, full outside off, dropped towards backward point
plays this a little unconventionally, takes his eye off a short ball and swats it out to deep square
flicked from off stump down to long-on...takes him to 99
back of a length on off stump, pushed to the covers
works this from outside off towards mid-on, a well-judged single...fielder a little on his heels
plays a length ball back to the bowler so he'll have to wait a little longer
flicks a length delivery to midwicket
pushes this to the left of mid-off, so over to Stokes on 99
cuts square of the wicket but point dives well to keep him on strike
there it is! Whips a back-of-a-length delivery through midwicket and that's his maiden ODI hundred off 98 balls. A tremendous innings. England were tottering when he arrived.
gets inside the line and swivels a short ball behind square on the leg side
that was in the air fairly close to cover, a crisply-timed push from Buttler, in the end it nearly beats the cover sweeper such is the timing
worked down to long-on...think of the second but Stokes' legs are feeling it
tucked off the pads to long leg
he can't go on! Tries to pull this over deep midwicket, gets a long way underneath the delivery, was a slower ball, and it doesn't have the legs as it lands in the lap of the man on the rope
defends a length ball to cover
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off where there is a fumble but think Buttler would have been safe
loses his line, slips onto the pads, flicked away fine but long leg does well to get around
round the wicket, Buttler steps to leg then punches to cover
well bowled, fired in straight, cramping him for room and can only play it back to the bowler
low full toss and Buttler misses out as he drives straight to point
a short ball, whipped along the ground through midwicket and they get back for the second...fresh legs in the middle could be important
holds the ball back, Buttler has to wait for it but then gets the weighted on his push through midwicket perfectly to allow him a second
full outside leg, clipped through midwicket again but kept to a single this time
gets across the crease and flicks from outside off to square leg, who cuts off the shot but then gives away an extra run as his throw cannons into the stumps
length ball outside, pushed into the covers
nice use of the wrists as he turns this from outside off through midwicket...these two eating up the yards between the wickets
a bouncer, angled over leg stump, defeats Moeen's attempt to hook
fuller, a flamboyant whip from Moeen sends the ball behind square on the leg side

and the short ball strikes! Mashrafe gets a key wicket with his final delivery. Came back over the wicket, it was a well-directed short delivery around leg stump, Moeen went for the hook and top-edged to long leg
full and straight, Shakib skips across to field
swift footwork, gets to the pitch, but it's just a single as he drives to long-off
dragged down a touch short, driven off the back foot to long-off
fuller, worked into the leg side, through midwicket...the boundaries have dried up
patted back to the bowler...very good from Shakib
leans back and drives square out to the cover sweeper. Another over without much damage done
excellent delivery, an off-stump yorker, Buttler runs it down to third man
low full toss outside, driven to deep cover
that's a gorgeous shot from Woakes, offered a length ball, opens the face and plays a lofted cover drive wide of the sweeper
responds with a yorker which he jabs down to third man
width on offer here but Buttler slices it to backward point...he hasn't quite found his stride so far
slower ball outside off, driven through the covers
fired in at leg stump, squeezed out towards short fine leg
another lofted drive, inside-out over cover, this time though it's closer to long-off
uses his feet but can only drive towards cover inside the circle
goes deeper in the crease to a shorter ball and flicks out to deep midwicket
and now he manages to break free, excellent use of the feet then a sweetly played lofted drive over wide long-on...pure timing from Buttler
and he goes again! A bit harder and bit longer this time. Very similar to previous delivery, sharp footwork got him to the pitch and this time he slots it slightly straighter, well beyond the ropes
full outside off, driven to cover on the edge of the ring
gets the yorker in, dug out between long-on and midwicket. Good scampering.
evades the fielder! A short ball, Buttler hooks, the top edge loops in the air behind square but long leg can't quite reach it with a sprawling dive
that reached the boundary in a flash...Buttler swats a back-of-a-length ball through midwicket. Fielders barely moved
length again, he's clothed this but gets another boundary as he swings it through square leg...problems for Bangladesh
how does he do that? An extraordinary shot to reach fifty (although we see them from Buttler all the time) as he plays a bottom-handed swat-turned-drive which clears long-off
length outside off, Woakes gets underneath this it and carts it over point...length is being dispatched
that's better, a yorker outside off, Woakes drives over the top of it...an appeal for an edge
gets away with a big full toss on the pads, he misses his swing and it bobbles to the leg side
filthy full toss outside off and he's sliced that clear of third man for six...looked like a thick outside edge to start with!
slower ball, tucked through midwicket
confusion in the outfield! Woakes heaves a short ball into the night sky and in the end two fielders end up looking at each other as the ball drops into space at midwicket. The bowler is furious
pushed wide outside off, it's a low full toss, comes off the bottom of the bat towards cover
well bowled, holds his nerve, sends that down with no pace at all, Woakes is through his shot, deflects of Mustfiqur's pads
comes down the pitch, misses his whip to the leg side, takes the pad and deflects wide of the keeper, an appeal for lbw but he's miles down the pitch
that's a huge full toss but it brings the wicket, Buttler gets it on the cue end of the bat and it ends down at long-off. They check for the height, but there's no issue there
down the pitch and driven past the bowler

the double play from Bangladesh! Willey dug out a full ball back to the bowler. Shakib collects, throws down the stumps and the TV replay shows Woakes is short. Bangladesh had made sure by then throwing at Willey's end too. All that means it's a dot ball to finish.

inn2.comm: short of a length on the hip, clipped behind square towards long leg
full at off stump, offers to swing in, defended square to the off side

goodness me! That's a statement and a half. It's a length ball outside off and Kayes, who smashed a hundred against England a couple of days ago, picks it up over deep square leg with free-flowing swing of the arms
full, pushed across outside off, drew him wide into a drive and beats the edge
nicely bowled, back of a length this time, hint of movement off the seam and Kayes is feeling at fresh air
fuller, onto the front foot, pushing at the ball and it runs off a thick edge along the ground, wide of second slip, and fine of third man
left arm over the wicket, full at off stump, hint of swing, he stretches forward and defends to cover
a flowing cover drive to a full ball outside off but he picks out cover
holds his bat inside the line as this is on a length outside off
a touch fuller, swings away outside off, Tamim shoulders arms
keeps it full outside off, Tamim happy to let it through to the keeper again
goes straighter, back of a length, bounces off the thigh pad behind square on the leg side so it's an extra but a maiden for Willey
a flashing drive to a full ball outside off, nearly nicks it through to Buttler...just enough movement to encourage the seamers
back of a length, short of a length, takes a leading edge towards cover as he aims to work to leg
well bowled, slides this one past the outside edge as Tamim tries to get onto the front foot
the variation of the shorter ball, angled across outside off, Tamim tries to fetch it into the leg side with a pull and is beaten for pace
goes fuller, at the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler with a bit of a walking shot
short of a length outside off, Tamim plays a forcing back-foot shot which evades a diving backward point and travels to third man so he steals the strike again
full at off stump, Willey a gentler pace to Woakes, Tamim gets forward and defends to the leg side
comes forward into a drive and picks out mid-off...after that first-over flurry things have calmed down
angled into the pads, thought he didn't make contact but must have got a thin tickle on that
gets across the crease and defends to mid-on
short of a length, he pulls off the front foot and the ball balloons in the air behind square but falls in front of short fine leg...actually only came off the body
that's nicely played, Willey gets his line wrong, pushed into the pads and Tamin flicks it fine of short fine leg
over the wicket, short of a length, Kayes hops into a defensive shot
a slower ball, full at off stump, defended to the covers
reacts to the dot balls by charging down the pitch and trying to flay this through the off side but ends up swinging and missing
back of a length, at off stump, cover is quickly in to stop the single
opens the face to a length and ball, slides to backward point
gets forward but can't beat backward point as he plays with an open face...a maiden for Woakes
a tempting delivery, full outside off, but there's enough swing to take it away from the left hander and beats the drive
reaches for this touch then angles it down to third man
that's wild hoick to the leg side, short of a length outside off, tries to mow it towards cow corner and it skims through to the keeper
another leg-side heave but gets a decent bit of willow on this, it was a fuller ball, he played it off the front foot and dragged it through midwicket
full again, outside off, he's a little early into his shot and the ball squeezes out to the leg side
sliced away from outside off, in the air around where a fine gully might have been
full at off stump, pushed to the covers
a sharp bouncer defeats Kayes' pull shot, but is then called wide for height...fair enough call
tries to make something out of a length ball, moving around his crease, gets towards leg stump but it comes off a bottom edge into the pitch
extra bounce from short of a length, takes the splice of the bat but loops wide of backward point
a fresh-air shot as he charges down the pitch outside leg then tries to reach for a ball outside off
short of a length, stays in his crease and plays a one-legged whip-pull that finds square leg
worked off the stumps behind square on the leg side
that breaks the shackles a little as Tamim throws everything into a lofted square drive which he slices a touch but gets it well over the infield
another strong drive, this time all along the ground, mid-off is able to scoot around and intercept...he looks keen to get on with it
he likes the leg side! Another one clears the ropes, not by as far as the first, as he bends his back he and cross-bates this from outside off over deep midwicket
a straighter delivery, Kayes drives and almost spoons a catch to cover...the ball straightened on him a fraction
gets in a bit of a tangle against a shorter delivery, ends up bobbling off his body to the off side
loses his line onto leg stump and that's clipped away behind square, so it becomes a very productive over for Bangladesh
full and straight, defended
short of a length outside off, carved down to third man
short ball, Tamim is down the pitch again and doesn't make contact as he tries to go through the off side with a cross-bat shot
nicely bowled, a slower ball which takes the top edge as Tamim tries to angle away but it falls short of Buttler
drive-and-run towards mid-off, Moeen Ali too far back to cut off the single
short ball, goes for the pull, is a little cramped for room and it goes in the air but falls short of Willey running in from deep square
over the wicket, full at middle and off, defended
another pull that falls short of deep square leg, Kayes almost picked out Moeen on the rope
defended to the off side...the ball from Ball hitting the bat quite hard
on leg stump, tries to swing it away but doesn't make contact

maiden wicket for Ball! The innings has been a little block or bash, this time Tamim swings across the line of a short-of-a-length ball and skies it high into the off side where Vince eventually settles under it at cover
off the mark first ball. Not in control, slashing at a short delivery outside off, gets a thick top edge which flies over slip
beats him with a ball angled across
latches onto a short ball, pulled off the front foot well in front of square...think we've worked out his favourite area
slower ball, full outside off, pushed towards point who could probably have done better to try and stop it
length ball at off stump, defended to the covers
and now he's on the pull as well, crisply struck through midwicket, Bairstow is quickly around the boundary
worked into the leg side
back of a length at middle and leg, Kayes nearly spoons it back to the bowler as he tries to tuck into the leg side
a bouncer over off stump, Kayes drops his hands then ponders whether it should be a wide call...the umpire doesn't believe so
short again, moves to the leg side, goes over the top edge as he tries to carve over cover...was an off-cutter
beats the top edge again! Not quite as short, done for pace as he tried to cut over point
worked off the body in front of square
comes down the pitch then pulls over midwicket, doesn't come out of the middle but plops into space
good length outside off, opens the face to third man
that's a lovely piece of timing and placement, just a hint of width from Stokes and Kayes opens the face to glide it wide of third man...Stokes not impressed by the placement of Rashid down there
this time he ramps a short ball to third man and it's straight at Rashid...would have been amusing to see Stokes' face if that had beaten him on the other side
clears the front leg and drives, picks out cover
full at off stump, defended to cover
that's a delightful stroke, Stokes gets too full, Sabbir whips it way from about middle and off with a lovely flick of the wrists through midwicket
that's crunched! Another short ball gets dispatched through midwicket by a Kayes pull stroke, saw it early and played well in front of square
worked off the pads behind square and placed well for a second
beats him with one pushed across as Kayes tries to play it square on the off side
full on leg stump, flicked down to long leg
stand a deliver! Not out of the texbook as he swings a full delivery from off stump straight of mid-on. A very effective slog

Willey has pulled off a breathtaking boundary catch! This is outstanding work. Sabbir crunched a short ball towards deep midwicket, it seemed to be clearing the rope but Willey grasped it inside the boundary, but then knew he was going to go over the line so flicked the ball back inside, then leaped back into the playing area to holding the rebound. It's gone to TV and it's given! We see it fairly often these days, but still stunning
short ball first up to the new batsman, hooks down to long leg
beats the outside as this skids through on a full length outside off
good length at off stump, defended to backward point
back of a length, he opens the face but can't find space at point...Roy is quick across then takes a bit of a tumble as he gathers the ball
full outside off, slower ball, tapped to the off side
gets the line wrong, takes the pad and some edge the leg side and wide of a diving Buttler
sharp bouncer, over off stump, he's beaten for pace as he takes his eyes off the ball trying to pull
short of a length, swivels on a well-controlled pull this time to deep square
pushed to point
direct hit, but think the dive has saved him. Was pushed into the off side, Roy swopped from point and is on target but Kayes is safe. The bat hasn't bounced
beats the inside edge as he tries to drive, might not have bounced quite as he expected
tight to off stump, defended to mid-on
outside off and good zip through to the keeper. A flashy drive but nothing but an air shot
outside off again, keeping low and scuttling away off Buttler's shins
yeehah! That's the shot I play first up in the nets every week, three steps down the wicket, a wild swing with head to the skies, and no contact whatsoever
tucked into the leg side, and it's a direct hit but the batsman is safely home
onto the front foot, and pushed into the covers
slower ball, very full and hanging in the air as it doodlebugs its way down to the popping crease. A dab into the off-side and yet another direct hit from the covers. Sharp from England's fielders
on the pads, clipped fine to backward square leg
forward and blocked into the covers. A loud bellow of 'no!'
a high bouncer, flapped out to square leg with a swat off the eyebrows
worked off the pads to the leg side
whoops, that one slipped ... the dew coming into play, perhaps? A waist-high leg-side full toss. And a free hit coming up ...
short, slower, a horrid wipe off a top-edge, but who cares, there are no consequences or points for style. Buttler is rocked back on his backside as the ball loops over his head!
worked into the leg side to bring up the hundred. Bangladesh are giving this a right good go!
hmm, a bit of a long-hop loosener, sliding down leg
swept with confidence, out to backward square leg
a strong bottom-handed drive into the covers
finds the gap in the covers this time, and with excellent timing too. The sweeper dives to tidy up
outside off, and through to the keeper
a tremendous crunch of bat as Kayes nails another slog-sweep, but this time it's picked up on the bounce in the deep
reverse dab, it fizzes away very fine, and that's a leaky first over from Rashid
back and across and chopped fiercely out to deep cover
clipped off the pads, out to backward square leg
up on the toes, and punched off the back foot to cover
attempted reverse sweep, and this one grips on the surface and flicks off the glove into the visor. Just as well his lid got in the way
nurdled out to the leg side
another easy nudge into the gap. Singles will suffice for the moment
clubbed down the ground and that has powered to the rope through long-on! Pushed through from Rashid, but right into the middle of a very willing bat!
googly, well bowled, drifted in and kept cramping the batsman for room. Kept it out in the end
smashed down the ground again and a fumble from Woakes at mid-on. No chance to take the extra run though
clipped to the leg side
smashed through the leg side, just heaving through the shot as Rashid plugs away on a middle stump line. The shots are coming out now ...
full face as Rashid finds a more conventional legbreak line, drifting onto leg stump and threatening to turn
worked round the corner off the full face of the bat
high-elbowed nudge into the leg side
on the hip, clipped to the leg side
swept and swept fine. There's no cutting that one off, as Moeen strays onto the pads and pays the price!
full toss, pumped into the leg side
down the track, two strides and a pause to re-establish his base, then an easy flick in front of square on the leg side. Good placement to keep the strike
zeroing in on leg stump, and blotted to leg

tossed onto the leg stump, smashed with a well-timed sweep, but straight to Billings at deep midwicket! He smothers the chance in his midriff, rolls back to cushion the catch, and that is a very timely breakthrough!
on the toes, clipped to leg
down the leg side, one more to the total, and we'll have that one again
big appeal as Buttler half-gathers down the leg side, but fumbles in the end. Umpire Erasmus signals it was pad
worked to the covers to get off the mark
worked into the leg side to keep the strike
dabbed back down the pitch
a big wind-up on the attempted sweep, but extra bounce beats his swishing blade
down the leg side, free runs to backward square
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
high-elbowed drive into the covers. Lots of pleasing technique on show today. A propos of nothing
tapped to gully, another sharp single
tossed up high, dipping late, driven hard to long-off
on the pads, tucked square
another easy single into the gap
pushed back down the pitch, and annoyance from Rahim that he didn't find the single
he finds the gap this time, a tap-and-go back down the wicket
outside off, a squeezed drive to the point sweeper
pumped on the up, two steps to meet the pitch and eased through the line of the ball over long-off. Top ball-striking
worked into the leg side
buzzers. A poke into the off side, a sharp shy from point but the keeper can't gather and they steal an extra run
on the pads, flicked square
worked off the face of the bat to backward square leg
round the wicket, and pushed back to the bowler
spanked high and mighty ... but straight to Billings once again at cow corner! He looked as though he'd leathered it, but he's picked out the deepest point of the field. And the ground goes silent
full length, pushed back down the pitch
full toss on the hip, and that's an absolute freebie. Drops to one knee and helps the ball into space behind square
swept behind square and that's well placed. A long chase for square leg to tidy up
width outside off, cut hard into the off side but straight to the fielder
this one grips from outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
round the wicket and that one fizzed! Extra bounce over the top of middle and past a slightly startled drive
clipped round the corner to square leg
more bounce from a full length, pushed to point
attempted sweep, and not for the first time, that rebounds into his face. No lid at the moment, but he's hard
on the hip, flicked square for another single
outside off, chopped to the cover sweeper
advancing down the wicket with intent, but not quite timed
banged in short, worked into the leg side for another single. They all count
pounded furiously out to deep cover
fierce lift from a not-terribly-short length. Pulled uneasily out to square leg
big stride, full stride, and Woakes at mid-off was inches away with a despairing dive! But that was nailed, and it's four more!
fuller length, poked to cover, a few words of advice from Stokes, and another productive over for Bangladesh
round the wicket, pushed back down the pitch
solidly forward, dead-batted into the off side and a sharp single
misfield from Stokes, that's a rarity, but Kayes has cramped up after turning for the second run through third man. This could be problematic
played off the back foot down to long-off
gets onto the pads, flicked to short fine leg, almost confusion in the running...this could be a tricky time
significant turn there for Moeen, was quite short outside off, comes off the face of Shakib's bat to short third man
round the wicket, back of a length, he throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge fine of third man
short, pushed down the leg side, gets an extra run and an extra Jake
short again, Stokes persisting with the approach, Kayes not entirely convincing as he pulls and it comes off the glove wide of Buttler
fuller this time, angles in from round the wicket, Shakib guides it to third man...there's no need for anything silly
short outside off, a slightly half-hearted jab from Kayes and it loops over backward point...he hobbles for a single
gets inside the line and pulls a short-of-a-length delivery wide of long leg
short, pulled, takes the glove fine down the leg side and that's a boundary that keeps Bangladesh well on track...short ball is proving costly
pushed to cover
comes forward and flicks through midwicket

just short! Doesn't quite Vince at long-off, Shakib trying to go down the ground but a hint of turn means it comes off the outer part of the bat. Vince running in, dived forward, was still short of him
worked through midwicket
that's a terrific shot although just a single as he drives with an open face over cover...Vince in action again
turned around a little as this one grips, trying to work to the leg side
full and straight, clipped to long leg
back of a length outside off, steered wide of backward point
uses his feet and works a length delivery into the leg side
neatly played, flicked from outside off through the leg side
shorter delivery, Shakib misses out on his pull and is taken high on the leg
a little ungainly as he takes this from outside off and hauls it wide of midwicket
needs to be careful, a bit of a headless shot as he comes down and tries to take this over the leg side and gets an outside edge to short third man
more calmly played through the off side
driven down to long-off
moves to the leg side then drives a full delivery to the cover sweeper...200 brought up and greeting by plenty of noise
worked through the leg side
follows him as he moves outside leg, worked a single through midwicket to keep the strike
back of a length, angled down the leg side, Shakib is across the crease but gets the wide call...fifty stand comes up
that's flayed square through the off side as Willey offers some width but deep cover is quickly around
full at off stump, dug out wide of mid-on who is inside the circle
uses his feet then drives firmly towards mid-off who them opts to shy at the far end where Kayes is running to, but it's all safe
slower ball, half volley outside off, driven sweetly but straight to cover
short, pulled towards long leg, slips through Ball's legs at long leg but it doesn't prove costly as the batsmen aren't alert to the misfield
finishes the over with another slower ball which is driven to mid-off
driven into the off-side ring
swept very strongly from outside off straight to deep square
fantastic stroke, gives himself room by moving outside leg then drills his drive through the off side...not a million miles from cover
now this is a bit more ugly as he heaves to left of long-on, Moeen followed him
played off the back foot to cover
flicked out to deep square leg...two away from his hundred now

what a way to reach a hundred! That's careless from Willey - unless he's pulled off a run out, of course - as Kayes jabbed a full ball straight back to him and Willey flung the ball back at the stumps, Kayes is well back, and it deflected away to fine leg for a boundary
tucked through square leg
short ball, over leg stump, through to the keeper and it's okay with the umpires
full at off stump, jabbed to the off side for a scampered single
moves to the leg side then hoicks a length ball wide of mid-on, races across the outfield and Roy can't flick it back...might have hurt his shoulder as well
uses his feet and drives to mid-on...very good over for Bangladesh
good clean blow from Shakib as he drags this over mid-on and with the legs to clear the boundary
pushed into the off side, can't beat cover
lovely, again, from Shakib as he uses sharp footwork to meant the ball then he chip-drove it straight down the ground
driven to deep cover and that takes him to a superb half-century from 39 balls
worked off the back foot to deep midwicket
drives a full delivery to long-off
that's a scything blow square of the wicket as he latches on against a wide ball, rockets behind point and wide of third man
comes round the wicket, cut towards point
full outside leg stump, takes the pad
round the wicket, banged in short, looked quite short but he gets away with it
it's all running for Shakib, and Bangladesh, as he goes after a wide ball and slices it off the top edge fine of third man
that's brilliant batting, on the charge, as he gives himself a touch of room to the leg side then cuts this wide of point with the power to beat the sweeper
full from round the wicket, aiming to work it to the leg side and nearly pops a leading edge back to the bowler

has Buttler dropped a catch? Looks like it may have taken the top edge. Was a well-directed bouncer which rushed onto Kayes, cramping him for room as he pulled. Buttler was almost starting to appeal when it clanged out
fuller, inside edge into the pads and rebounds to the off side
over the wicket, banged in short, tries to swat this through the leg side and nearly sends it straight back to the bowler
back of a length, swung to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full and way down the leg side
back to the short length, Kayes pulls and finds midwicket inside the circle
that's rifled down the ground, another thunderous strike from Shakib as he just stands there and drills the ball straight down back past the bowler
goes back to a shorter ball and drives to deep cover
opens the face and places it square to the off side
the googly, he runs it to backward point
good placement from Shakib as he drives this inside out over extra cover, well wide of long-off
dragged from wide outside off down to long-on
short again, England have persisted with that length, pulled through midwicket
that's a crunching blow as he pulls a ball from outside off through midwicket - almost literally - with immense power
he's gone! The short ball makes the breakthrough. Shakib pulls, can't keep it down - or beat the fielder - and is taken low down at midwicket
dragged on! Two in two for Ball. He is pumped. Complete silence in the stadium. Short of a length, nips back, takes the bottom edge into the stumps
full at off stump, calmly played back to the bowler
that's a very good short ball, starts outside off and follows Mashrafe as he arches his back to get out of the line
full outside off, whipped to deep midwicket
all his experience will be vital here and Mashrafe eases this out to deep cover
touch shorter, worked from outside off deep into the leg side
a googly, touch of extra bounce, Mashrafe plays it off the back foot to the covers
and another! He's nicked a short ball...it was that to smash, really, but he was looking to be careful and guide it to third man and instead just got a thin edge to Buttler
another googly, pushed back to the bowler
short, loopy, goes across Kayes who lets it go through and gets the wide call
full at middle and leg, flicked strong but deep square keeps it to a single
full at off stump, defended to cover
another bouncer, over middle and off, Mosharraf ducks underneath
poor ball, full and flung down the leg side, Bangladesh won't care how they come
tucked away nicely off the pads to long leg
full outside off, heaved out to deep midwicket

appeal for lbw but that clearly pitched outside leg, he fell across the line trying to work it away. Well, England have reviewed this, not sure why unless it's to give them a few moments to gather themselves. It's so far outside leg. A chance to get a drink on board, perhaps, but they could regret that still

stumped off a wide! Sharp work from Buttler and this is going wrong for Bangladesh. Rashid speared it wide, not sure whether it was entirely to plan, Kayes came down the pitch and was nowhere near reaching it. Buttler hand plenty of time to drag the ball back to complete the dismissal
that's a huge swing and miss! Pressure, pressure, pressure. Buttler doesn't glove it cleanly
another googly, rips back and don't think he picked that
tossed up outside off, given him some air to tempt him, goes for a might drive but it just dribbles back to Rashid
nice leg-break, pitches and straightens, defended
missed by a whisker! Has another huge swing at a googly which is millimetres from off stump
and he finishes with another legspinner which turns to beat Shafiul's attempted drive...another one comes out of Buttler's glove, but no edge
round the wicket, on a good length, beats the outside edge
it's all happening! He nearly spoons a catch to mid-off, it falls short then Rashid pulls off the direct hit and they got upstairs. He's miles out!
stays round the wicket, full at off stump, pushed to cover
good work from Buttler as he moves to his left to cut off a bottom edge
brings out the slog, swings a short-of-a-length ball over midwicket and finds plenty of space
full and straight, gives himself a touch of room and drives to deep cover
defends a short ball
spins quite sharply and it goes down the leg side...no wide, umpire thinks it clipped the pad
huge appeal for lbw as he misses his slog-sweep and gets taken on the back pad. England wasted their review earlier
very full and he squeezes it out off an inside edge past leg stump and short fine leg has to chase it down
goes for a slog sweep, misses again, pitches outside leg this time
another swing and a miss, Rashid tosses up a googly which he doesn't pick. It also bursts through Buttler's gloves but doesn't cost a bye
round the wicket, full and straight, does well to open the face and play it to third man
dragged down short and wide, batsman gave himself room but it's wide enough anyway for the call
short of a length, angled in, sliced down to third man with a cramped cut shot
beats the edge as he drives at a full ball...close to taking out off stump as well
short of a length, a cutter banged into the surface, he's through his shot way early as he tries to club to the leg side

it's five to win the match! Another cutter, fingers rolled over the ball, it was fuller this time, Taskin heaving to the leg side again and he gets a top edge which is well held by Buttler diving forward
